VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Customer Support relative to the peak of Delivery Speed in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Customer Support is to the {left} of the peak of Delivery Speed.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Delivery Speed show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Delivery Speed shows a {Periodic fluctuation}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Return Policies} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =16.6?
EVJ.A: At X =16.6,the label with the highest density is {Return Policies}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 73? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Customer Support or Delivery Speed?
NC.A: {Delivery Speed} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Personalization or Delivery Speed?
NC.A: {Delivery Speed} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Personalization or Loyalty Programs?
NC.A: {Personalization} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Loyalty Programs or Return Policies?
NC.A: {Return Policies} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Return Policies}
